page.title: 19Elwick C.of E.Primary School
page.content: Elwick school is twenty six years old. It was built closer to the village than the old school, which is over a hundred years old. The old school is now used as a church hall. The new school has only fifty four pupils and three full time teachers. All the teachers live in Elwick. Eight years ago it had 105 pupils. Children come to the school from Dalton Piercy, Elwick and all the farms in the district. The school has visiting teachers who come to teach violin and cello. There are three classes in the school with pupils in them from the age of four to eleven. The school is in very pleasant surroundings and there is no vandalism at all in or around the place. It has a good playing field, but it is not big enough for full size football matches and games.
